context: Subsequently, in <a0_0><b8_0>October 2001<b8_0/><a0_0/>, U.S. forces (with <a1_0><b9_0>UK and coalition allies<b9_0/><a1_0/>) invaded Afghanistan to <a2_0>oust the Taliban regime<a2_0/>. On <a3_0>7 October 2001<a3_0/>, the official invasion began with British and U.S. forces conducting airstrike campaigns over enemy targets. <b5_0><b10_0>Kabul<b10_0/><b5_0/>, the capital city of Afghanistan, fell by mid-November. The remaining al-Qaeda and Taliban remnants fell back to the rugged mountains of <b6_0>eastern Afghanistan<b6_0/>, mainly <b11_0>Tora Bora<b11_0/>. In December, Coalition forces (the U.S. and its allies) fought within that region. It is believed that <b7_0><b12_0>Osama bin Laden<b12_0/><b7_0/> escaped into <a4_0>Pakistan<a4_0/> during the battle.
